_header: King I sit and look about
Note:
Cf. Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, nos. 10344, 7035, 26495.
Subjects: human life, transitory nature of; translations; Fortune, wheel of
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Queen’s College Horne 25 (13), f. 64: incorrect reference.
_description: The Vicissitudes of Life, a tag in the Fasciculus morum — four couplets, translating Latin lines, each spoken by a king on the Wheel of Fortune

BodLauMis213.First Lines:
kyng y sitt and loke abowtto morne y may be wo
                    out…
BodLauMis213.Last Lines:
…y schalbe kyng þat men schal seeBut as all reche y schal
                    ded bee

Bod187.First Lines:
kyng y sytte & loke a bowteTo morwe y may be with
                    owte…
Bod187.Last Lines:
…y shal be kyng þat men shul seeWhenne þu wrecche
                    ded shalt be
Bod187.Note:
Written as prose. Each couplet is followed by its Latin
                    version.

Bod410.First Lines:
Kyng I sit & loke abouteto moru I may be with
                    oute…
Bod410.Last Lines:
…Not long a gon I was ful rychebut now is pore & riche
                    alych

BodRawC670.First Lines:
Kyng I syt & loke abouteTo morn I may ben with
                    oute…
BodRawC670.Last Lines:
…I shal be kyng þat men schull seWhen þe wreche ded
                    shal be
BodRawC670.Editions:
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 80-1.

CamGon71.First Lines:
I sitt & I loke aboutTo morne I may be holden with
                    out…
CamGon71.Last Lines:
…I schal be kyng þat men schal seewhen þu wreche ded
                    schal be

CamGon364.First Lines:
Kyng I sytte & loke aboutTho morwen I may ben al way
                    oute…
CamGon364.Last Lines:
…I schal ben kyng þat man schal seWanne þou wreche
                    ded schal be

CamStJohn159.First Lines:
Kyng I sytt and luk a bowtTo morn I may be all with
                    owt…
CamStJohn159.Last Lines:
…Woo ys me a kyng I wasÞis world I loffede bot þo
                    alas

BLHar7322.First Lines: Linge i sitte and loke abouteto morwen y mai beon wiþoute…
BLHar7322.Last Lines: …Ich shal beo kinge þat men shulle seoWhen þou wrecche ded shalt beo
BLHar7322.Note:
Appears separately, in a section on pictura de Fortitudine. Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.

                            on f. 7.

EDU82.First Lines:
Kyng I sitte and loke a bowteto morowe I may be al with
                    owte…
EDU82.Last Lines:
…I schal be kyng þat men schal seewhen þu wreche
                    dede schal be

Lincoln44.Transcription:
kyng y sytte & loke a bouteto morw y may be al with outeWov
                    ys me a kyng y wasÞis world y loued but þat alas

Spalding.First Lines:
Kyng I sytt and loke aboutetomorne I may be all with
                    oute…
Spalding.Last Lines:
…I shall be kynge þat men shall seeWhen I wreche dede
                    shall be
Spalding.Note:
Four couplets together, with no Latin prose text between; written as
                    prose.

WorcF19.First Lines:
Kyng y sit and loke a bouteto morwe y may be alden with
                    oute…
WorcF19.Last Lines:
…y schal be kyng þat men may sewan þu wrech ded
                    schal be
WorcF19.Note: 4 x 2, here written as verse and not separated.
